Name: Scarab with motif of a lion
Description: Steatite scarab with highly stylised rendering of the head as a wavy-rimmed, curve-based 'hour-glass' and trapezoidal inner head, and notch indicating each wing-case. The flat underside bears a motif of a lion striding over two plants. The style of the scarab top, and the dashes incised within the area of the lion are features of early 2nd Intermediate Period (18th-17th century BC) scarabs. At this date the scarab form was still being used as a seal for documents and commodity containers, whereas later it was used only in its other function as a talisman.
